newsitem.title: GERMANY: German states agree nationwide Scientology watch.
newsitem.headline: German states agree nationwide Scientology watch.

text.p: Interior ministers of Germany's 16 federal states said on Friday they had agreed to put the Church of Scientology under coordinated nationwide observation by the federal and state anti-extremist watchdogs.
Two large southern German states, Bavaria and Baden-Wuerttemberg, have already been carrying out surveillance on Scientology, which has accused Germany of persecuting it and its members.

The interior ministers, meeting for a two-day conference in Bonn, said they had decided that the group, which Germany sees as a profit-making organisation, not a religion, met the legal conditions necessary for observation.

"With Scientology there are really clues of efforts against the basic liberal-democratic order and therefore the legal prerequisite for an observation of the organisation by the protectorate of the constitution," the interior ministry of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern said in a statement.
Scientology, which is based on the teachings of late American science fiction writer L. Ron Hubbard, has accused Germany of mounting a "hysterical witchhunt" against it at taxpayers' expense.

The states said the federal and state anti-extremist watchdogs would be asked to develop a joint working concept on how best to observe the group and present a report to the interior ministers' conference in a year.
